intro: Corydalis pseudacropteryx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved corydalis, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant features slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, with flowers that are often arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Corydalis pseudacropteryx is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine.
